A UDP protocol used with BGP to assist in detecting link failures at a much faster rate than the native BGP failure detection."),React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"li",components:components,parentName:"ul"},"BFD works with any routing protocol, not just BGP."),React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"li",components:components,parentName:"ul"},"BFD must be explicitly enabled to work properly.")),React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"h3",components:components,props:{"id":"bgp---multi-exit-discriminator"}},"BGP - Multi-Exit Discriminator"),React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"ul",components:components},React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"li",components:components,parentName:"ul"},"Allows the border router of an AS to tell neight ASes on which link it prefers to receive traffic."),React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"li",components:components,parentName:"ul"},"A low MED value is a higher preference and higher MED value is a lower preference."),React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"li",components:components,parentName:"ul"},"If there is a certain route that it wants to take eg. optic fibre, it wil take the preferred route. - There is a move preferred way to do this - ",React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"inlineCode",components:components,parentName:"li"},"AS_Path Prepending"))),React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"h3",components:components,props:{"id":"bgp---as_path-prepending"}},"BGP - AS_Path Prepending"),React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"ul",components:components},React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"li",components:components,parentName:"ul"},"AS_Path Prepending: is how BGP routers can see full routes to other ASes. Each router prepends its ASN to the beginning of the list. This allows the router to see the most efficient route to its destination."),React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"li",components:components,parentName:"ul"},"It can also be used to artificially lengthen the path of your route in order to advertise to other routers that it is not a preferred route and influence these routers to send to another link."),React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"li",components:components,parentName:"ul"},"You can only do this with a public ASN."),React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"li",components:components,parentName:"ul"},"In a case where there are more hops between routers on a less preferred route, the router "creates" artificial hops to change the preference of the path.")));}}]);return MDXContent;}(React.Component);export{MDXContent as default};MDXContent.__docgenInfo={"description":"","methods":[],"displayName":"MDXContent"};

sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'
  import { MDXTag } from '@mdx-js/tag'
  

export default class MDXContent extends React.Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props)
    this.layout = null
  }
  render() {
    const { components, ...props } = this.props

    return <MDXTag
             name="wrapper"
             
             components={components}><MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"advanced-networking"}}>{`Advanced Networking`}</MDXTag>
{/* TOC */}
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#advanced-networking"}}>{`Advanced Networking`}</MDXTag><MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#ipv4-and-subnetting"}}>{`IPv4 and Subnetting`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#vpn-fundamentals"}}>{`VPN Fundamentals`}</MDXTag><MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#keys"}}>{`Keys`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#auth-key-exchange"}}>{`Auth Key Exchange`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#message-intergrity"}}>{`Message intergrity`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#confidentiality"}}>{`Confidentiality`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#vpn-protocols"}}>{`VPN Protocols`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#ipsec-process"}}>{`IPsec Process`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#ike-key-exchange"}}>{`IKE Key Exchange`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#intro-the-bgp"}}>{`Intro the BGP`}</MDXTag><MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#terms"}}>{`Terms`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#about"}}>{`About`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#bgp-requirements"}}>{`BGP Requirements`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#bgp---operation-and-keep-alive"}}>{`BGP - Operation and Keep-Alive`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#bfd---bidirectional-forwarding-detection"}}>{`BFD - Bidirectional Forwarding Detection`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#bgp---multi-exit-discriminator"}}>{`BGP - Multi-Exit Discriminator`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#bgp---as_path-prepending"}}>{`BGP - AS_Path Prepending`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
{/* /TOC */}
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"ipv4-and-subnetting"}}>{`IPv4 and Subnetting`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`255.255.255.255`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`The `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`/8, /16, /24, /32`}</MDXTag>{` refers to how many bits are being masked. If it is `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`/17`}</MDXTag>{` for example, 17 bits are masked with `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`2^1`}</MDXTag>{` subnets and `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`2^15 - 2`}</MDXTag>{` available addresses with one address for the host and one for the network.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p">{`MPLS (Multi-Protocol Label Switching)`}</MDXTag>{`
Method by which a direct link between two or more sites is simulated by efficiently directing traffic over multiple points.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p">{`Addresses in 10.0.0.0/16 VPC reserved for AWS`}</MDXTag>{`
10.0.0.0, 10.0.0.1, 10.0.0.2, 10.0.0.3 and 10.0.0.255.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p">{`FEC (Forward Equivalency Class)`}</MDXTag>{`
A label applied to packets to allow routes to immediately know where to route them.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p">{`BGP`}</MDXTag>{`
AWS preferred Routing Protocol to route between multiple Autonomous Systems.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p">{`Encryption Keys that require both public and private`}</MDXTag>{`
Public-Key encryption (or asymmetric key encryption).`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"vpn-fundamentals"}}>{`VPN Fundamentals`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`What is a VPN?`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Virtual Private Network that exists to allow traffic to move securely and confidentially.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`There are two primary types:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Site-to-site: Two or more sites are connected without any software on the client machines. MPLS can be used to create this.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Client-to-site: Client has software installed that allows it to communicate with the site. Typically used for remote workers.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"keys"}}>{`Keys`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Symmetric-key encryption: All parties share the same key to encrypt and decrypt a message.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Public-key encrytion (asymmetric): Each party has a public-private key pair. One computer uses its private key to encrypt a message and the other uses its public key to decrypt.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"auth-key-exchange"}}>{`Auth Key Exchange`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">
<MDXTag name="p" components={components} parentName="li">{`RSA:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Asymmetric.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Used primarily in key exchange in other protocols, such as SSL. RSA is used to encrypt an AES key exchange.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`2048 bit encryption or higher is considered secure as 1024 has been theorized to be cracked by NSA.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">
<MDXTag name="p" components={components} parentName="li">{`Diffie-Hellman`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Faster than RSA`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Used by AWS`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Provides PFS`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">
<MDXTag name="p" components={components} parentName="li">{`PFS (Perfect Forward Secrecy)`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Means that the compromise of session does not endanger others. New keys are created for every session.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"message-intergrity"}}>{`Message intergrity`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`If intercepted, the message could be modified.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`To verify authenticity you have the following options:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`MD5 (Message Digest)`}<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`MD5 is broken, don't use for production environments.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`SHA (Secure Hash Algorithm)`}<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`SHA-1: 160-bit hash similar to MD5. Also considered insecure.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`SHA-2: SHA-2 includes SHA-256 and SHA-512.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`SHA-3: SHA-3 is the only member of the SHA family not created by the NSA.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"confidentiality"}}>{`Confidentiality`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Triple DES (3DES)`}<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Three symmetric keys with 56 bits each.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Slowly being phased out in favour of stronger encrytion keys.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Blowfish`}<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Fast algorithm.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Secure.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Blocks of 64 bits encrypted individually.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Twofish`}<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Successor to Blowfish`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Up to 256 bit in length`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`One of the faster algorithms`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`AES`}<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Standard for US Gov and many other organizations.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Symmetric key algorithm.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Uses 128, 192 or 256 bit encryption.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Widely regarded as the de-facto standard for message encryption.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Probably what is used in many instances.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"vpn-protocols"}}>{`VPN Protocols`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`PPP`}<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Point-to-point protocol used to encrypt traffic within a tunnel.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`PPP is Layer 2 protocol.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`PPTP`}<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Point-to-point tunnel protocol.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Establishes GRE tunnel. Then uses PPP to encrypt and authenticate the traffic.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Uses simple password auth.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`L2TP`}<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Layer 2 transfer protocol.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Created by Microsoft and Cisco to combine LTP and PPTP to create a more secure protocol using IPSec.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`IKEv2`}<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Internet Key Exchange version 2`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Used with IPSec and was created by Microsoft and Cisco to be faster than L2TP.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`SSL VPN`}<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Can be initiated through a web browser.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`An SSL VPN does not require VPN client software.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`OpenVPN`}<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Uses OpenSSL library. Open source and frequenctly updated.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Commonly considered the most secure VPN protocol.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`IPsec`}<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`SA: Security association that describes the security features of an IPsec connection.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`AH: Auth header. Guarantees connectionless integrity and data origin of IP packets Auths entire packet, with the exception of mutable fields such as DSCP/ToS. Does not encrypt the payload.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`ESP: The Encapsulating Security Payload provides encryption and authentication. But only authenticates contents of the packet.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Transport Mode: Encapsultes the payload of a packet. Used for most client to server relationships.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Tunnel Mode: Encapsulates the entire IP packet. Used for most VPNs.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"ipsec-process"}}>{`IPsec Process`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`IKE Phase 1`}<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Endpoints use ISAKMP (Internet Security Association and Key Management Protocol) to authenticate and negotiate the keys. This creates an encrypted tunnel used by Phase 2 for negotiating the ESP security associations.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Uses an auth Diffie-Hellman exchange to match the PSKs.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Main Mode: Most secure. Provides complete security of the key exchange.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Aggressive Mode: Uses half the exchanges in the key exchange process, but transmits some information in cleartext.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`IKE Phase 2`}<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`The endpoints use the tunnel created in Phase 1 to negotiate ESP SAs. The ESP SAs encrypt the actual user data.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`After phase 2, the tunnel is created.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"ike-key-exchange"}}>{`IKE Key Exchange`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`The nodes must agree on the following:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`The encryption algorithm. AES is an example.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`The bit-strength of the encryption key. This is commonly a Diffie-Hellman group.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`The authentication method. Typically an RSA digital signature.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`The hash algorithm. Usually SHA-1 or higher.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`The auth material. This is usually a PSK.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"intro-the-bgp"}}>{`Intro the BGP`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"terms"}}>{`Terms`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`AS (Autonomous System): is a network or collection of network controlled by a single entity. Such as a corporation or university. An AS has its own routing table.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`AS Number: Provided by IANA to identify individual ASes.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`BGP (Border Gateway Protocol): A routing protocol used to route between multiple Autonomous Systems.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`EGP (Exterior Gateway Protocol): BGP is an example of an EGP. EGPs are used to route between organization/networks or Autonomous Systems.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`IGP (Interior Gateway Protocol): A routing protocol used within an Autonomous System. RIP, EIGRP, IS-IS and OSPF are examples.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Multihoming: Having two separate ISPs for a network. Typically used for failover, redundacy or bandwidth.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"about"}}>{`About`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`How the `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`entire`}</MDXTag>{` internet communicates. We'e all used it. BGP is the only protocol that operates outside of an AS.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`eBGP is for external communication between ASes.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`iBGP allows communication from within an AS.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Most internal routing is done via IGPs such as OSPF, but iBGP can be used if very large routing tables must be transferred between border routers.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"bgp-requirements"}}>{`BGP Requirements`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`ASN: You will need an ASN. You can request an ASN fro ARIN or your country's regional provider.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`You must have a multi-homed network or prove intention to obtain one.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`BGP4 capable router with sufficient hardware specs.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Fully function IGP.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"bgp---operation-and-keep-alive"}}>{`BGP - Operation and Keep-Alive`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`BGP uses "Keep-Alive" signals and a configuratble timer to detect if a peer is down. If a peer goes down, it will remove the dead peer's route from its advertisements. AS routers continually talk back to each other.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"bfd---bidirectional-forwarding-detection"}}>{`BFD - Bidirectional Forwarding Detection`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`"Bidirectional Forwarding Detection". A UDP protocol used with BGP to assist in detecting link failures at a much faster rate than the native BGP failure detection.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`BFD works with any routing protocol, not just BGP.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`BFD must be explicitly enabled to work properly.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"bgp---multi-exit-discriminator"}}>{`BGP - Multi-Exit Discriminator`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Allows the border router of an AS to tell neight ASes on which link it prefers to receive traffic.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`A low MED value is a higher preference and higher MED value is a lower preference.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`If there is a certain route that it wants to take eg. optic fibre, it wil take the preferred route. - There is a move preferred way to do this - `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="li">{`AS_Path Prepending`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"bgp---as_path-prepending"}}>{`BGP - AS_Path Prepending`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`AS_Path Prepending: is how BGP routers can see full routes to other ASes. Each router prepends its ASN to the beginning of the list. This allows the router to see the most efficient route to its destination.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`It can also be used to artificially lengthen the path of your route in order to advertise to other routers that it is not a preferred route and influence these routers to send to another link.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`You can only do this with a public ASN.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`In a case where there are more hops between routers on a less preferred route, the router "creates" artificial hops to change the preference of the path.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
           </MDXTag>
  }
}
